allOf.description: Is the status algorithm recognized in regulatory frameworks of leading government bodies?

Category.description: Algorithm that behind the implementation of the revocation (Bitlist = each credential has a position in the list. Deny-List: revoked credentials will be added on demand. Accumulator: cryptographic proof the holder presents to show that the credential is not revoked)

Performance.description: How performant is the revocation mechanism (for issuer, holder and verifier)?
Performance.$comment: For this case there could be some king of test framework

allOf.description: Does the Verifier have the possibility to observe the revocation status beyond the presentation?
Does the issuer have possibilities to trace the usage of his issued credentials through the revocation mechanism?
allOf.$comment: With a size of one used element the issuer should always be able to trace the usage of his issued credentials

allOf.description: At what scale has the algorithm/technology been demonstrated to work? Are there any known issues?
Does the revocation mechanism support an authentication if the holder is offline?
